answers.answer: Hi,you need to discuss a lot more with your doctor.  Can you get referred to a diabetes educator?What insulin are you on? When do you take it?A long acting insulin may be taken even with normal blood sugar levels.A short acting insulin may be taken before meals to ensure sugars don't go too high are eating.If you are low, then you may need to eat or adjust insulin levels.Please discuss with your doctor.
I concur with sally, you need to be educated or re-educated on the usage of insulin.

question: do i take insulin when my meter reads normal ?do i take insulin when my meter reads low?do i take insulin when my meter reads high?
title: not sure of what to do
